titleInfo.title: Augmented reality as a tool for linguistic research: Intercepting and manipulating multimodal interaction

name.namePart: International Conference on Intelligent Virtual Agents

mods.abstract: We suggest that an Augmented Reality (AR) system for coupled interaction partners provides a new tool for linguistic research that allows to manipulate the coparticipants’ real-time perception and action. It encompasses novel facilities for recording heterogeneous sensor-rich data sets to be accessed in parallel with qualitative/manual and quantitative/computational methods.
